Reviews.Title: “Good 3 star hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: Tazz13
Reviews.Content: As always this gets five stars based on what was paid. This is not a high end luxury hotel. However, the rooms are small but clean and well maintained. Staff are polite and efficient. The breakfast buffet is good, for 10 Euros extra per person. The hotel is a good location, even for tourists. Grand via is about 20 minutes walk away, there is a metro station within 5 minutes. Would definitely recommend for a stay in Madrid. However, if you want to go to the conference centre, then it is about an hour away, so probably not the best option.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect neighborhood, perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: 55711Spaingirl
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It's in the stylish and cozy Salamanca district, close to businesses, stores, restaurants and lovely plazas. They treat you well, they are professional, it is clean, the breakfasts are amazing and the rooms are very nice. It has all the elements that you need to be comfortable and while it could use a little updating, the bathrooms are terrific and everything is well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent three-star hotel in the best area”
Reviews.Author: Franciscoar
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Hermosilla is a three-star that could have a fourth one because of the services, cleanliness and its location in the best shopping area in Madrid. The receptionists are kind and helpful. Actually, they provided us with a sewing kit we needed and gave information about the latest shows and events in Madrid. The room and the bathroom are spacious, the safe can be operated easily and the beds are the very best. We'll certainly come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights and we found it was everything we wanted. (Well, apart from tea and coffee making facilities in our room, but that's nit-picking). Our room was always immaculate when we came back to it after a day spent in the city. It's in a quiet street yet within a short walk of a metro station. There are good restaurants and cafes nearby. As we had a late flight home it was very helpful to be able to leave our luggage at the hotel while we spent the afternoon finishing off our mini-break.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Iberia2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the metro & has excelent shopping options close by. The rooms were big and the bed was very comfy. Music in the bathroom was a nice touch! Downside: corner of Hermosilla & Lagasca gets really loud late at night on weekends as people leave bars & no restaurant on property. For the price it's an excelent choice in fancy Barrio Salamanca.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in premium location in barrio Salamanca, Madrid”
Reviews.Author: JorgeLD
Reviews.Content: Small boutique hotel. Nice decor. Location is absolutely perfect! I loved it. Food at the breakfast buffet was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: randomname
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home from 5 days in Madrid staying at Hesperia Hermosilla and what a great time we had. This is a very attractive hotel in a really good location close to Metro stations, high class shopping and some great pavement cafes. Upon arrival we were informed that we had been upgraded to a superior room (good start!). The room was quite spacious with a nice king size bed, large wardrobes, a working safe, and a good quality hairdryer (my wife informs me). Great bathroom with walk in shower, WC and bidet. The room was very clean and was cleaned to a high standard every day. The staff were very friendly and spoke good English (better than my Spanish certainly!) and were always helpful. Slight downsides? No tea/coffee facilities in the room. There is a menu for a local pizza company in the rooms. Avoid. It took me 36 hours to recover from a very dodgy pizza! All in all, this is a fab hotel with nice staff, clean and spacious and in a very good location. We would definately recommend and visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!! Nice breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: NandoVellutini
Reviews.Content: We had a nice surprise , arrived in the heart of Salamanca in this hotel that we only got to know about consulting the reviews on tripadvisor! Excellent Location , clean ,outstanding breakfast , Nice rooms with Good shower and cute view to the streets outside the windows!! Not luxury but more than necessary for a confortable staying! Worth its value with great recomendation !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Staff; Comfortable but Basic Room”
Reviews.Author: DCTravelFan100
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Hermosilla. This is an extremely well located hotel. The staff is gracious and quite helpful. We stayed in a standard room. The beds were very comfortable. The room was very clean. Having read reviews on TripAdvisor, we had exactly the right expectations for the room and the hotel. The bedroom was somewhat tight, although it seemed much airier due to the very high ceilings and the ceiling to floor window. There is a nice desk area and a small flat screen tv. The closet is nice sized. Also, the safe in the closet is big enough to store a laptop. The bathroom was fairly spacious, although toiletries are somewhat limited. For example, there is a gel dispenser in the shower; there is no separate shampoo. Our room was on the first guest floor of the hotel, facing the street. There were some street noises. We generally are not noise sensitive travelers, so this did not unduly bother us. If you are noise sensitive, however, you probably would want to be on a higher floor or in a room that does not overlook the street. Previous reviewers noted how slow WiFi is -- that is true. Also, the business center consists of an older computer on a desk near the reception area. There is a printer. Serviceable but not a separate full business center. Overall, however, this is a very good, well run hotel. I recommend it. I would stay there again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Basically fine but...”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Sarah
Reviews.Content: My main reservation for this hotel is lousy internet access. Wifi is supposed ot e free of charge. I would rather pay and have it reliable than have it free and barely usable. First you need to get user name and password from front desk. This was not disclosed to me when I checked in. Onlyafter frustrating 30 minutes when I came down to reception, I got a printed piece of paper with the secret codes. Then, it is my second day and the internet barely works. It takes forever to connect, kicked me out several times and my password had to be changed three times already. Other than that, it nice, clean and convenient to shopping and business. No restaurant on premisses but there are a few nice ones near by. I like the TeatreZ, two blocks away. Great restaurant, very niece tapas bar (conveninet if you don't want to wait for the 9PM dinner time), and it has English menues upon request. Short walk to metro. Front desk ladies do not go out of their way to be helpful, but pleasand enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...signs of shoestring spending”
Reviews.Author: wellensian
Reviews.Content: Location: Superb corner location in tree-lined street surrounded by high class shops in the Salamanca district. Owned by NH but quite different in feel. Rooms are spacious and light but furnished more cheaply than the usual NH. The floors are some sort of laminate and the furniture is stuck-on veneer rather than wood. Replacement light bulbs could not be found. On the other hand the bathrooms seem to be where all the money was spent and are excellent (except that they provide shampoo from a wall dispenser rather than the usual NH toiletries). Staff: The staff I encountered were very friendly and helpful but sparse in number, consisting, for most of the day, of a single receptionist attempting to handle three checkouts while answering all telephone enquiries, (there must also be cleaners etc) All in all, the hotel is perfectly satisfactory, but could use an NH upgrade and with youth unemployment at an all-time high in Spain, would benefit from more staff. The fourth star reflects the location and service rather than the accommodation (which alone would be a 3) furniture

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: pariszmyspot
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered a great value in a wonderful neighborhood. We selected it for its location in a plentiful shopping district, great room rates, convenience to Metro, and plentiful selection of neighborhood restaurants. Hotel staff is briskly professional - responsive to questions and requests but no warm fuzzies. The room was a reasonable size for two travelers with decent closet space, in-room refrigerator and a large bathroom - very important for two female travelers. No on-site restaurant but this was not an inconvenience as there are plenty of nearby eating options in the neighborhood. Liked best - location and price; least - nothing.

Reviews.Title: “basic but functional”
Reviews.Author: hotel101
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night. It is very basic but clean and functional. The plusses - free high speed internet access in your room; the rooms are clean and modern and stylish; fairly decent selection of satellite tv channels considering its a 3 star. The minuses: The rooms are small. Don't even bother with breakfast unless it's included in your room rate. The basin is in the room - it's not a separate bathroom - well there's a "cupboard" that hosues a separate shower and loo (no bath). v. small. Very little external light. The position of the tv was such that you had to sit at an angle to view it. Like I said, I was just there for a night and had a standard room - I'm not sure if the others are better. It served it's purpose

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view on a quiet street”
Reviews.Author: hokuhoshi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three nights at Hesperia Hermosilla at the end of July. We booked a Superior room at a great rate via the hotel website. When we arrived, we were given room #508. It was the top floor and had slanted walls, dark, and a very small window. We were quite disappointed. I asked the front desk if they had any other superior rooms available for our stay. The staff member was gracious about our request and switched us to room #208. Beautiful!! Large airy bright room with sophisticated color scheme. Huge windows with two small balconies. Views of the charming street, yet quiet at night. Wireless access with good connection. The area is in the middle of the shopping district, and not too far from Retiro Park and the Prado. Madrid is very accessible via the public underground trains. Not a lot of amenities, but we prefer it that way when we're in a larger city. There is a breakfust buffet for a cost, but Starbucks is right around the corner, plus other nice little cafes and a small grocery store. Great price, and set a nice tone for our visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: NYtraveler80
Reviews.Content: If you are just looking for a place to check into for a night or two, this is the place for you. I guess the rate is reasonable for its location considering that it's located in the Salamanca District. Since this is a shopping/financial district, there is aboslutely no night life after 11pm. You have to understand that the price you pay for this hotel is that it comes with no service. There is no one to help you carry your luggages to your rooms or any basic items that you might be asking for (etc. iron, extra towels). The room was clean but aren't all two star hotels clean and modern these days? The only positive aspect about this hotel is that it's located near great shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Just a nice bed”
Reviews.Author: nishcapish
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't exactly say this is a hotel, I would describe this more as a room that you check into. I think this is probably a hotel that is suitable for people who speak the language pretty well, rather than non spanish speaking people. I say this because the hotel staff is of no help (the morning staff is not bad though). They basically are there to swipe your credit card, and they don't do it with a smile. The rooms are ok with good amenities. The area is good for shopping and thats it. Its dead after 9, and there is not a lot to see, but it is close to the metro so it is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in the upscale Salamanca area - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: ttips
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during at the end of Sept 2007. This was a great boutique hotel to stay in while in Madrid. The staff was excellent. The accommodations were super. We had a room with a queen size bed. The room was large with extra high ceilings. It overlooked the quiet street of Hermosilla and was very quiet while sleeping. The air conditioner was even quiet when it was running. The location was also great, on a quiet street with many sights in walking distance - the Prado, Thyssen B, Retiro Park, Plaza Colon and Metro station. Even Plaza Mayor was in walking distance or a short metro ride. We would easily stay here again and recommend it to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Combe274
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed in this hotel for three nights starting Friday 4 May 2007. It's in a great position, central yet nice and quiet. The rooms are a good size and the bathroom is quality. It's close to the metro and just round the corner from the fabulous park. The hotel is well decorated and looks classy. The reception staff speak better English than my Spanish (not difficult) and are very friendly and helpful. Storing bags on the day of departure was no problem. We never used the breakfast buffet prefering Viene bakery on Goye just round the corner where coffee, juice and a pastry was a bargin 3 Euros. Three nights for just over £200 in the middle of a captial city - bargin and warmly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite so far in Salamanca neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: gsfromc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of nights in Jan./07. Located in the upscale Salamanca area, lots of shops, restaurants and very safe to walk around at night. Located on a quiet street, the newly renovated property is bright, open and well decorated. Very friendly staff. I had one of the standard rooms on the 5th floor, non smoking. The room was "compact" but very bright and well decorated. Wall-hung plasma tv, king bed, large desk with free wifi. The sink is in the main room and a rather small toilet/shower area. I think some of the other rooms may be larger and next time I'll try the Superior room. Breakfast is pretty standard fare @ 15 euros. If you come out of the hotel, turn left from the front door and then left again about a 1/2 block up the street is a market with lots of stalls for buying fresh fruit and supplies. Further up this street is also another small supermarket. About 1-2 blocks to the metro, Hard Rock Cafe.

HotelInfo.Name: Hesperia Hermosilla
HotelInfo.Address: Calle de Hermosilla 23 | Esquina Hermosilla-Lagasca, 28006 Madrid, Spain
